detaileddescription.para: Creates a new Message object. This message will be created with object data and not with byte data. The message can be serialised for the byte data used over the network.

inbodydescription.para: < retrieve the base object and use it to update the underlying base object details
< Check to see that the base Object class can be retrieved and then update details
< retrieve the base object and use it to update the underlying object details
< set Message data to the ByteArray data that was passed in
< Increment the number of references to the ByteArray data

simplesect.para: TRUE on success, FALSE on failure.

briefdescription.para: Initialises a Message object from byteArray data.

parameterdescription.para: The byte data for the object. The data will not be copied but referenced by this object.

simplesect.para: TRUE on success, FALSE on failure.

detaileddescription.para: Gets a Message from another object. Use this to avoid casts.

parameterdescription.para: The object to obtain the Message from.

detaileddescription.para: destroys the memory allocated to a Message object.
locks contain transaction information and use a proof of work system to show that they are legitimate.
